title: Causal Mediation Analysis Estimating Interventional Effects Mapped to a Target Trial
text: Causal mediation analysis methods commonly used research studies explore causal pathways linking exposures outcomes. Traditional mediation analysis aims decompose total effect exposure outcome natural direct indirect effects, natural indirect effect capturing exposure effect acting mediator. However, goal research studies, especially health medical research, often elucidate extent hypothetical interventions targeting mediators counter exposure effects. suggests shift focus warranted, effect decomposition explicitly evaluating hypothetical mediator interventions may inform future policy, practice intervention development. Interventional effects (VanderWeele, Vansteelandt, Robins 2014) mediation estimands aligned interventional focus addressing key identifiability challenges associated natural effects (Robins Greenland 1992). Indeed, interventional effects shown implicitly emulate effects target trials (Hernán Robins 2016) assessing impact distributional shifts mediators (Moreno-Betancur Carlin 2018). Based concept, Moreno-Betancur et al. (2021) proposed definitions interventional effects map explicitly target trial assessing hypothetical mediator interventions specific interest, making particularly useful policy-relevant evaluations applied research illustrated several published examples (Dashti et al. 2022; Goldfeld et al. 2023; Afshar et al. 2024).

what: Interventional effects: definition and estimation methods
title: Causal Mediation Analysis Estimating Interventional Effects Mapped to a Target Trial
text: Moreno-Betancur et al. (2021) provided definitions interventional effects based three types hypothetical mediator interventions. vignette, describe estimands corresponding mediator interventions, implemented medRCT R package. type mediator intervention can specified using argument intervention_type. default, intervention_type = "", estimates three types interventional effects, : shift_all: estimand corresponds intervention shifts joint distribution mediators exposed, given confounders, match corresponding distribution unexposed. shift_k: estimand corresponds intervention shifts distribution specific mediator exposed, given confounders, match corresponding distribution unexposed, independent without considering flow-effects mediators. shift_k_order: estimand corresponds intervention shifts distribution specific mediator exposed, given confounders, match corresponding distribution unexposed, considering flow-effects causally descendant mediators. medRCT estimates interventional effects based interventions using Monte Carlo simulation-based g-computation approach, described Vansteelandt Daniel (2017). number Monte Carlo simulations can specified using argument mcsim, allowing users balance computational efficiency estimation accuracy. default number Monte Carlo simulations used 200. Additionally, medRCT automatically removes records missing data analysis variables, performing complete-case analysis.

what: Getting started with medRCT: Estimating interventional effects
title: Causal Mediation Analysis Estimating Interventional Effects Mapped to a Target Trial
text: medRCT package designed handle complex mediation settings involving multiple interrelated mediators intermediate confounders (exposure-induced mediator-outcome confounders). supports range variable types. Specifically, supports categorical exposures two levels (Levels ≥\geq 2). outcome variable, medRCT supports binary continuous outcomes. Additionally, supports number mediators. mediator, including primary interest (.e., intermediate confounders), can either binary continuous. number type baseline confounders supported. makes package suitable broad range real-world applications epidemiology, public health, social science research. begin illustrating estimate three different types interventional effects presence multiple mediators intermediate confounders. intermediate confounders can specified using argument intermediate_confs. consider following example using simulated data inspired case study within Longitudinal Study Australian Children (LSAC) (Goldfeld et al. 2023). Specifically, aim estimate difference expected outcome (risk child mental health problems) exposure (low socioeconomic position) versus without hypothetical intervention individually shifts distribution mediator (parental mental health preschool attendance) levels unexposed (high socioeconomic position), accounting baseline confounders, intermediate (exposure-induced) mediator-outcome confounder correlations amongst mediators. summary table: IIE_all estimated interventional indirect effect applying hypothetical intervention specified shift_all. hypothetical intervention improving mental health parents children preschool attendance low socioeconomic position levels high socioeconomic position potentially prevent 1 per 100 cases child mental health problems. IIE_k estimated interventional indirect effect applying hypothetical intervention described shift_k specific mediator k. hypothetical intervention improving mental health parents children (IIE_1) low socioeconomic position levels high socioeconomic position potentially prevent 1 per 100 cases child mental health problems. Meanwhile, effect hypothetical intervention preschool attendance (IIE_2) negligible. IIE_k_prime estimated interventional indirect effect specific mediator k, accounting flow-effects descendant mediators hypothetical intervention described shift_k_order. hypothetical intervention improving mental health parents children (IIE_1_prime) low socioeconomic position levels high socioeconomic position, accounting flow-effects preschool attendance, potentially prevent 1 per 100 cases child mental health problems. TCE estimated total causal effect.
code: library(medRCT) #> medRCT: Causal mediation analysis estimating interventional effects mapped to a target trial #> Note: When setting intervention_type = 'shift_k_order', the order of the mediators as specified  #> in the 'mediators' argument is important.  # Set a seed for reproducibility set.seed(2025) # Display the first few rows of the dataset head(LSACdata) #>   child_sex child_atsi mat_cob mat_engl mat_age sep fam_stress parent_mh #> 1         0          1       0        0       1   0          0         0 #> 2        NA          0       0        0      NA   0         NA        NA #> 3        NA          0       0        0      NA   0         NA        NA #> 4        NA          0       0        0      NA   0         NA        NA #> 5         1          0       0        0       1   1          0         0 #> 6         1          0       0        0       1   0          1         1 #>   preschool_att child_mh child_SDQscore #> 1             1        0       8.924660 #> 2             0        0       7.349826 #> 3             0        1      12.824643 #> 4             0        0       6.611369 #> 5             0        1      10.329341 #> 6             0        1      13.552515  # Define confounders for the analysis confounders <- c("child_sex", "child_atsi", "mat_cob", "mat_engl", "mat_age")  # Define intermediate confounders intermediate_confs <- "fam_stress"  # Estimate interventional indirect effects med_res <- medRCT(   dat = LSACdata,                         exposure = "sep",                       outcome = "child_mh",                   mediators = c("parent_mh", "preschool_att"),    intermediate_confs = intermediate_confs,    confounders = confounders,   interactions_XC = "all",   intervention_type = "all",   bootstrap = TRUE,   boot_args = list(R = 100, stype = "i", ci.type = "norm"),   mcsim = 200                           ) #> Assumed causal order for estimating effect of type 'shift_k_order': parent_mh, preschool_att #> Conducting complete case analysis, 2499 observations were excluded due to missing data.  # Summarise the results summary(med_res) #>  #> Estimated interventional indirect effect:  #>  #>                                  Estimate Std. Given reliance cross-world counterfactuals, effects criticized capturing effects interventions policy measures conducted real world (Naimi, Kaufman, MacLehose 2014). , independence assumption required can never guaranteed, even experiment (Robins Richardson 2011; Didelez, Dawid, Geneletti 2006), renders estimands unidentifiable common settings exposure-induced mediator-outcome confounding multiple mediators (Avin, Shpitser, Pearl 2005; VanderWeele, Vansteelandt, Robins 2014; Vansteelandt VanderWeele 2012). However, context multiple mediators, certain path-specific natural effects, also defined terms cross-world counterfactuals, can still identified may substantive interest (VanderWeele Vansteelandt 2014). Interventional effects proposed alternative address limitations. title: Causal mediation analysis estimating interventional effects mapped to a target trial
text: Using simulated dataset based published case study Longitudinal Study Australian Children (Goldfeld et al. 2023), illustrate use medRCT estimate interventional effects emulate target trial. Specifically, aim estimate difference expected outcome (risk child mental health problems) exposure (low family socioeconomic position) versus without hypothetical intervention individually shifts distribution mediator (parental mental health preschool attendance) levels unexposed (high family socioeconomic position), accounting baseline confounders, intermediate (exposure-induced) mediator-outcome confounder (family stressful life events), correlations amongst mediators. begin loading library dataset, defining confounder vector. Next run analyses, estimating interventional effects hypothetical intervention shifts distribution mediator individually. Note 1: dataset missing data. Incomplete records default deleted analysis. Note 2: recommended perform analysis least 200 Monte Carlo simulations setting mcsim = 200. illustration purposes, use mcsim = 50, takes approximately 90 seconds run. Based estimated interventional effect (IIE_1), hypothetical intervention improving mental health parents children families low socioeconomic position levels families high socioeconomic position potentially prevent 1 per 100 cases child mental health problems. Meanwhile, effect hypothetical intervention preschool attendance (IIE_2) negligible. detailed guidance using package handle complex scenarios, please refer vignette.

title: Causal Mediation Analysis Estimating Interventional Effects Mapped to A Target Trial — medRCT
text: dat data.frame containing dataset analysis. include variables exposure, outcome, mediators, (baseline) confounders, intermediate (exposure-induced) mediator-outcome confounders specified analysis. exposure character string specifying name exposure variable dataset. exposure variable must categorical, 0 explicitly denoting unexposed (control) group, taken reference group. values represent different, non-reference exposure categories. outcome character string specifying name outcome variable dataset. outcome variable can binary continuous. mediators character vector specifying names variables dataset corresponding mediators interest. mediators can binary continuous. estimating effect type "shift_k_order", order mediators vector important must correspond assumed causal ordering mediators. intermediate_confs character vector specifying names variables dataset corresponding intermediate confounders. intermediate confounders can binary continuous. NULL, intermediate confounders specified. confounders character vector listing names variables dataset corresponding baseline confounders. interactions_XC character string specifying two-way interactions exposure baseline confounders include regression models estimation procedure. default value, "", includes two-way exposure-confounder interactions excludes confounder-confounder interactions. Specify "none" exclude two-way interactions exposure baseline confounders. See Vignette details. intervention_type character string indicating type interventional effect estimated. Options include: "" (default): Estimates three types interventional indirect effects. "shift_all": Estimates interventional indirect effect mapped target trial assessing impact shifting joint distribution mediators exposed, given baseline confounders, match corresponding distribution unexposed. "shift_k": Estimates interventional indirect effect mapped target trial assessing impact shifting distribution specific mediator (k) exposed, given baseline confounders, match corresponding distribution unexposed. "shift_k_order": Estimates interventional indirect effect mapped target trial assessing impact shifting distribution specific mediator (k) exposed, given baseline confounders, match corresponding distribution unexposed accounting flow-effects causally descendant mediators. effect_measure character string specifying effect measure calculate. continuous outcome, "Diff" (difference means) allowed. binary outcome, must either "RD" (risk difference) "RR" (risk ratio). specified, defaults "Diff" continuous outcomes "RD" binary outcomes. one effect measure can specified time. mcsim integer specifying number Monte Carlo simulations perform. default 200. recommended run analysis fewer 200 Monte Carlo simulations. bootstrap logical value indicating whether bootstrapping performed. TRUE (default), bootstrapping conducted using boot function boot package. boot_args list arguments bootstrapping. default settings : R: Number bootstrap replicates (default: 100). stype: Specifies statistic type passed boot function (default: ""). ci.type: Specifies type confidence interval compute (default: "norm"). ... Additional arguments passed boot function boot package.
